setting.reset-data-tip: Are you sure you want to reset all data? (Including chat and settings data)
setting.temperature-tip: Higher values will make the output more random, while lower values will make the output more focused and more deterministic.
setting.title: L-GPT Setting

token.how-token-work-1: It is calculated according to the rules of each language model based on the total length of the current session content.
token.how-token-work-2: When the conversation reaches a certain length, you will no longer be able to add any more messages to the conversation. This is a contextual limit on the conversation content of each language model.
token.how-token-work-3: For example, GPT-3.5 allows a maximum of 4,096 tokens per session. GPT-4 allows a maximum of 8,192 tokens per session in its 8K model, and a maximum of 32,768 tokens in its 32K model. The context length limit may increase for various language models in the future.
token.how-token-work-4: If the current conversation reaches the context limit, you can delete some of the conversation content or start a new conversation to continue chatting.
token.how-to-cost-1: Any content related to a chat conversation will incur conversation costs.
token.how-to-cost-2-1: All costs are "estimated values" calculated by
token.how-to-cost-3: Each language model has its own pricing, and the corresponding official website has a detailed description of the pricing.
token.know-more: Click here to learn more about OpenAI models, tokens, and context limits.
token.token-desc: Tokens are the basic unit that LLM models use to compute the length of a text. They are groups of characters, which sometimes align with words, but not always. In particular, it depends on the number of characters and includes punctuation signs or emojis.

welcome.apply-openai-key: If you don't have an OpenAI API Key, you can get one here:
welcome.desc: L-GPT is an open-source project that helps you improve your learning, work, and life efficiency by providing various AI models.
welcome.set-openai-key: Please click on the settings button in the lower left corner to configure your API Key.

zLog.title: Project Release Announcement v0.4.0
zLog.text1: Since the project was launched, I have been using my personal API Key (no need to configure additional keys). As the number of users increased, it became a bit difficult. Therefore, in the previous version, the key was replaced with a free key that is not bound to a credit card.
zLog.text2: OpenAI's free API key has a very strict call frequency limit of only 3 calls per minute, which is clearly insufficient to meet the demands.
zLog.text3: Therefore, this version includes an account system. You can configure your own API Key without logging in, and after logging in, you can enjoy free and more stable services.
